p: Twenty‐four 2 m × 2 m plots, separated by at least 50 cm, were established at the study site. All above‐ground vegetation and most roots were removed in 12 plots to mimic Mikania control and removal. The remaining 12 plots were left untouched. Four sowing densities of Pueraria (0, 100, 200, and 400 grains/m 2) were each replicated in three cleared and three uncleared plots. All seeds were treated with H 2SO 4 and sown after radicle emergence. Pueraria and Mikania plants in each plot were harvested six months after sowing and fresh above‐ground biomass (stem + leaf material) determined for each species. Samples were also oven‐dried to determine dry weight.
